name: Client and Matter Risk Assessment - Corporate / Non-Natural Person
description: Client and Matter Risk Assessment - Corporate / Non-Natural Person

fields.label: Trading address (if different from registered address)

label.value: Type of entity
Existing or new client

content.text: At this stage, record facts only. Do not assume anyone’s identity has yet been verified. The Compliance Assistant will determine who must be verified and to what standard.

fields.label: Number of directors / members / partners / trustees

label.value: In what countries are the directors/members/partners/trustees resident?
options: All resident in the UK / European Economic Area
Some resident in the UK / European Economic Area and some resident elsewhere
All resident out with the UK / European Economic Area

fields.hint: The European Economic Area (EEA) includes all 27 European Union (EU) member states plus three non-EU EFTA countries: Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway

fields.label: Number of beneficial owners
fields.hint: A beneficial owner is any individual who ultimately owns or controls the client, including anyone with >25% ownership, voting rights or control, or for trusts, the settlor, trustees, beneficiaries, or others exercising control.

label.value: In what countries are the beneficial owners resident?
options: All resident in the UK / European Economic Area
Some resident in the UK / European Economic Area and some resident elsewhere
All resident out with the UK / European Economic Area

fields.hint: The European Economic Area (EEA) includes all 27 European Union (EU) member states plus three non-EU EFTA countries: Iceland, Liechtenstein, and Norway

label.value: Is ownership or control of the client directly or indirectly held by an entity incorporated in a jurisdiction outside the UK/EEA that does not maintain a public beneficial ownership register or equivalent AML supervision?

fields.hint: Select “Yes” only if any intermediate corporate is located outside the UK/EEA in a jurisdiction lacking public beneficial ownership transparency or AML supervision equivalent to the UK (e.g., BVI, Delaware). UK/EEA ownership should not trigger “Yes”

label.value: Does the client have an overly complex or convoluted layered ownership structure?
Does the ownership structure use any nominee shareholders or bearer shares (i.e., where the true owner is not publicly disclosed)?
Does the ownership chain include a trust or foundation (e.g., as a shareholder, controller, or ultimate owner)?
Is the work to be carried out routine for Eventus?

fields.label: Expected value of transaction
fields.hint: If the matter doesn't involve a transaction, please enter £0

label.value: Is this expected to be a one-off instruction or part of an ongoing relationship?
Country of incorporation / residence

fields.hint: Please consult the Eventus AML Compliance Assistant for further guidance on FATF-equivalent and HRTC jurisdictions

fields.label: In what countires does the client operate?

label.value: Does the client carry out any operations, activities, or transactions in a FATF-listed High-Risk Third Country or in any jurisdiction subject to UK sanctions?

fields.hint: Please consult the Eventus AML Compliance Assistant for further guidance on FATF-listed High-Risk Third Countries

label.value: Sector risk (based on Eventus' PWRA)
options: Standard - Typical Eventus client sectors (professional services, property holding, manufacturing, retail etc.)

Higher-risk - Sectors identified as heightened ML/TF risk in Eventus PWRA, including: cash-intensive trades (e.g. hospitality, construction, transport), cryptoasset activity, gambling, private wealth / family office work, unregulated financial services, or property development involving offshore structures.

Prohibited (outside Eventus' risk appetite) - Sectors Eventus will not act for (e.g. weapons or defence brokering, shell companies with no legitimate purpose, unlicensed money services, clients whose beneficial ownership cannot be established).

fields.hint: Please consult the Eventus AML Compliance Assistant for further guidance on sector based risk

label.value: Is the client subject to AML supervision or regulation by a UK or EEA competent authority (e.g. FCA, HMRC, SRA, Law Society of Scotland)?

fields.hint: Select “Yes” if the client is AML-regulated (e.g. financial institution, solicitor, accountant, estate agent). Select “No” for unregulated trading or holding companies

fields.label: Section 5 - Source of Funds / Wealth Indicators

label.value: Does this matter involve movement or receipt of funds?
Will funds be received into Eventus' client account?
Who is providing the funds?
What is the source of funds?
options: Client's accumulated profits (from trading in the UK)
Client's accumulated profits (from trading out with the UK)
Sale of business/assets/subsidiary company in the UK
Sale of business/assets/subsidiary company out with the UK
Capital injection / shareholder loan from a clearly identifiable (i.e. not opaque), UK/EEA resident beneficial owner
Capital injection / shareholder loan from a non-UK/EEA resident or non-transparent (i.e. opaque ownership structure) owner

label.value: Will funds originate or terminate out with the UK?

fields.label: Please confirm the anticipated timing / volume of receipts

label.value: Are you aware of any factors that make the transaction unusual, complex, or economically irrational?
Has the client or its representatives been reluctant or slow to provide information or documentation?
